description: Fix 11 conversion and copy issues identified in page audit — align copy with service, fix currency, strengthen sections, add missing content

userStories.title: Fix Shift section 'What actually works' copy
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want the 'What actually works' column to describe paid subscriber acquisition (not content consulting) so the page doesn't overpromise.
acceptanceCriteria: Replace 5 'What actually works' bullet points with copy about strategic paid acquisition, real subscribers, targeted campaigns, compliance, and measurable results
No references to content strategy, content pillars, or video engineering
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Fix proof explanation text
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want the proof explanation to accurately describe how the case study results were achieved.
acceptanceCriteria: Remove references to 'restructuring the channel' and 'engineering subscriber conversion into every video'
Replace with copy about targeted advertising campaigns and strategic subscriber acquisition
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Unify currency to USD across entire page
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want consistent currency so I don't get confused by mixed $ and € symbols.
acceptanceCriteria: Convert proof metric €0.39 to $0.40 (or equivalent USD)
Convert FAQ reference from €0.39 to $0.40
All monetary values use $ symbol
No € symbols remain on the page
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Fix 'not for you' contradiction about speed
userStories.description: As a visitor, I don't want to see contradictory messaging about speed expectations.
acceptanceCriteria: Replace 'You need instant results from a single campaign' with wording about guaranteed specific numbers regardless of niche
No contradiction with hero promise of fast results
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Remove case study placeholders
userStories.description: As a visitor, I should not see empty 'coming soon' placeholders that signal the business is new.
acceptanceCriteria: Remove both case-study-placeholder HTML blocks
Remove case-studies-grid container div
Page renders cleanly without gaps after proof section
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Differentiate Problem (01) and Shift (02) sections
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want sections 01 and 02 to feel distinct rather than repetitive.
acceptanceCriteria: Problem section (01) focuses on WHY channels fail (emotional/relatable)
Shift section (02) 'What doesn't work' focuses on specific TACTICS people try
Shift section (02) 'What actually works' aligns with LYNCK's actual service
No duplicate messaging between sections
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Add 'ad spend' FAQ question
userStories.description: As a prospect, I want to understand total cost (service fee + ad spend) before purchasing.
acceptanceCriteria: Add FAQ item: 'Is the ad spend included in the price?'
Answer explains: service fee covers strategy + management, ad spend is separate, typical range provided
Placed logically in FAQ order (after pricing-related questions)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Add post-purchase timeline/expectations
userStories.description: As a buyer, I want to know what happens after I pay so I feel confident purchasing.
acceptanceCriteria: Add FAQ item: 'What happens after I purchase?'
Answer includes timeline: onboarding, campaign setup, first subscribers, reporting cadence
Clear, specific time expectations (days, not vague)
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Reduce nav badge size
userStories.description: As a visitor on a laptop, I don't want the nav bar taking up excessive vertical space.
acceptanceCriteria: Nav Google Partner badge reduced from 66px to 48px height
Nav bar total height is reasonable (~60px)
Badge still clearly visible and clickable
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Fix comparison table width constraint
userStories.description: As a visitor, I want the comparison table to have enough room for its 3 columns.
acceptanceCriteria: Comparison table breaks out of .narrow container constraint
Table uses full .container width (1200px) not .narrow (720px)
Table content is not cramped on medium screens
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Add meta description and OG tags
userStories.description: As a marketer, I need proper meta tags for SEO and social sharing.
acceptanceCriteria: Add meta description tag (~155 chars, includes key value prop)
Add og:title, og:description, og:type, og:url tags
Add twitter:card, twitter:title, twitter:description tags
HTML validates without errors
